Description: Gold offering spoon in the form of a large shell. Two joining fragments of gold sheet.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Town (Naukratis), Found by locals looting the site between 1884-5 “south-west of the town at a high part, lying in the loose dust among the houses”
Curator's comments: See Jet handle from similar offering spoon British Museum 1888,0601.75. Found with a first century AD hoard, though may be of a much earlier type.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (3124)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 43-4, pl. XXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QB.15)
